sentences.text: PROPOSAL 6 - SHAREHOLDER PROPOSAL ENTITLED SPECIAL SHAREOWNER MEETINGS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Company has been advised that Mr. John Chevedden, 2215 Nelson Avenue, No. 205, Redondo Beach, CA 90278, who has dicated he is a beneficial owner of no fewer than 50 shares of the Companys common stock, intends to submit the following oposal at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, Shareowners ask our board to take the steps necessary (unilaterally if possible) to amend our bylaws and each appropriate governing document to give holders in the aggregate of 10% of our outstanding common stock the power to call a special shareowner meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal does not impact our board's current power to call a special meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delaware law allows 10% of our shares to call a special meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special meetings allow shareowners to vote on important matters, such as electing new directors that can arise between annual meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner input on the timing of shareowne meetings is especially important when events unfold quickly and issues may become moot by the next annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is important because there could be 15-months or more between annual meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal is particularly important because we do not have the opportunity to act by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of Fortune 500 companies provide for shareholders to call special meetings and to act by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We as shareholders need to be empowered especially since the price of our stock has been dead money for the year preceding the submission of his proposal - including a dip below $110.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perhaps a proxy advisory firm will recommend that companies like ours, with no written consent opportunity for shareholders, in turn allow for 10% of shareholders to call a special meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It may be possible to adopt this proposal by incorporating brief text similar to this into our governing documents: Special meetings of the stockholders, for any purpose or purposes, unless otherwise prescribed by statute, may be called by the Chairman of the Board or the President, and shall be called by the Chairman of the Board or President or Secretary upon the order in writing of a majority of or by resolution of the Board of Directors, or at the request in writing of stockholders owning 10% of the entire capital stock of the Corporation issued and outstanding and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote to enhance shareholder value: Special Shareowner Meetings - Proposal 6
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Statement in Opposition to Proposal 6:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote AGAINST proposal 6, as the Board believes that providing holders of only 10% of the Companys outstanding common stock the power to call a special meeting of stockholders is unnecessary and not in the best interests of the Company or its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders currently have a meaningful, balanced right to call a special meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Bylaws already permit stockholders who own 25% or more of the Companys outstanding common stock, on an aggregate net long basis, to call a special meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 25% minimum threshold is a reasonable one that strikes the right balance between ensuring that stockholders have a means of calling a stockholders meeting and protecting against the risk that a small minority of stockholders could trigger a special meeting and its associated financial expense and disruption to the Companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current right of stockholders to call a special meeting reflects purposeful decision-making by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board evaluated a number of different factors in adopting the existing right of stockholders to call a special meeting, including the interests of the Companys stockholder base, the resources required to convene a special meeting and the existing opportunities stockholders have to engage with the Board and senior management in between annual meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also considered the characteristics and composition of the Companys stockholder base, including that three stockholders each held, and continue to hold, greater than 5% of our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that providing stockholders owning 25% of the Companys outstanding stock the right to call a special meeting strikes a reasonable balance between enhancing our stockholders ability to act on important and urgent matters and protecting against misuse of the right by a small number of stockholders whose interests may not be shared by the majority of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Convening a meeting of stockholders also imposes significant administrative and operational costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company must prepare required disclosures, print and distribute materials, solicit proxies and tabulate votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant amount of attention by the Board, management and employees is required to prepare for special meetings, distracting them from their primary focus of maximizing long- term financial returns and operating the Companys business in the best interests of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because special meetings require a considerable diversion of resources, they should be limited to circumstances where a substantial number of stockholders believe a matter is sufficiently urgent or extraordinary that it must be addressed between annual meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unlike a 10% ownership threshold, the Companys 25% threshold prevents a small minority of stockholders from calling a special meeting and imposing these costs on all stockholders even when most stockholders do not want a special meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board believes the existing right of stockholders to call a special meeting provides a reasonable additional mechanism for stockholders to address important issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to strong and effective corporate governance practices and stockholder engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n addition to the existing right of stockholders to call a special meeting, the Board has implemented numerous corporate governance olicies that offer stockholders a meaningful voice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those policies offer the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ability of certain stockholders to include director nominees in the Companys proxy statements (as discussed further under Future Proposals of Shareholders);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The opportunity to elect directors annually using a majority voting standard;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ability to recommend director candidates to the Corporate Governance/Nominating Committee, which considers those recommendations in the same manner as recommendations received from other sources (as discussed further under Information Concerning the Board of Directors - Committees of the Board - Corporate Governance/Nominating Committee);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The right to submit proposals for inclusion in the Companys proxy statement for consideration at an annual meeting, subject to the rules and regulations of the SEC;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The opportunity to communicate directly with any member of the Board or Board committee; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The opportunity to vote annually in the say-on-pay vote to express their views on executive compensatio
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys long track record of performance demonstrates that the Companys existing corporate governance policies are effective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes that the proposal seeks to advance a solution to a problem that does not exist at the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: proposal ignores the tremendous shareholder value created by the Companys outstanding long-term performance and the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board and managements exceptional leadership, supported by the Companys existing corporate governance policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the Companys stock price grew from $79.95 at the end of 2011 to $278.41 at the end of 2016, representing a total shareholder return of 248% over the most recent five-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By comparison, the total shareholder return of the S&P 500 and the S&P 500 Retail Index during the same five-year period was 78% and 157%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, contrary to the proponents assertion the Companys stock price dipped below $110, the Companys stock did not close below $230 during any part of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, the strong performance of the Companys stock in both absolute and relative terms independently demonstrates that the proposal does not seek to address any performance-related deficiencies at the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the existing right of stockholders to call a special meeting, coupled with the Companys strong corporate governance policies and long track record of performance, the Board believes that adoption of the proposal is unnecessary and not in the best interest of the Company or its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the foregoing reasons, the Board of Directors recommends that you vote AGAINST proposal 6 to provide holders of only 10% of the Companys outstanding common stock the power to call a special meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with all proposals, if the proposal is not properly presented by the proponent at the Annual Meeting, it will not be voted upon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNEX A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OREILLY AUTOMOTIVE, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 INCENTIVE AWARD PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE I
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PURPOSE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The OReilly Automotive, Inc. 2017 Incentive Award Plan (as it may be amended, the Plan) was adopted by the Board of Directors of the Company, subject to approval by the shareholders of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of the Plan are to provide long-term incentives to those persons with significant responsibility for the success and growth of the Company and its subsidiaries, divisions and affiliated businesses, to associate the interests of such persons with those of the Companys shareholders, and to assist the Company in recruiting, retaining and motivating qualified employees on a competitive basis and to ensure a pay for performance linkage for such employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE II
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEFINITIONS AND CONSTRUCTION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wherever the following terms are used in the Plan they shall have the meanings specified below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The singular pronoun shall include the plural where the context so indicates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.1 Administrator shall mean the entity that conducts the general administration of the Plan, as provided in Article XII hereof, which shall initially be the Compensation Committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With reference to the duties of the Committee under the Plan which have been delegated to one or more persons pursuant to Section 12.6 hereof, or which the Board has assumed, the term Administrator shall refer to such person(s), unless the Committee or the Board has revoked such delegation or the Board has terminated the assumption of such duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.2 Affiliate shall mean
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any Parent or Subsidiary,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any entity that, directly or through one or more intermediaries, is controlled by the Company, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any entity in which the Company has a significant equity interest, in each case as determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.3 Applicable Accounting Standards shall mean Generally Accepted Accounting Principles in the United States, International Financial Reporting Standards or such other accounting principles or standards as may apply to the Companys financial statements under United States federal securities laws from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.4 Award shall mean an Option, a Restricted Stock award, a Restricted Stock Unit award, a Performance Award (which includes, but is not limited to, cash bonuses as set forth in Section 9.1), a Dividend Equivalent award, a Deferred Stock award, a Stock Payment award, an award of Stock Appreciation Rights, an Other Incentive Award or a Performance Share Award, which may be awarded or granted under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.5 Award Agreement shall mean any written notice, agreement, contract or other instrument or document evidencing an Award, including through electronic medium, which shall contain such terms and conditions with respect to an Award as the Administrator shall determine, consistent with the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.6 Board shall mean the Board of Directors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.7 Cause shall mean, with respect to any Participant, Cause as defined in such Participants employment agreement with the Company if such an agreement exists and contains a definition of Cause or, if no such agreement exists or such agreement does not contain a definition of Cause, then Cause shall mean
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the Participants substantial and continued failure to perform material duties in a satisfactory manner where such failure causes or is reasonably expected to cause material harm to the Company (other than a failure resulting from death or Disability for thirty (30) days after written notice thereof from the Company describing the failure to perform such duties;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the Participants engaging in any material act of dishonesty, fraud, embezzlement or misrepresentation that was or is likely to be materially injurious to the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the Participants knowing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: violation of any federal or state law or regulation applicable to the Companys business that was or is likely to be materially injurious to the Company; (d) the Participants material breach of any confidentiality
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: agreement or invention assignment agreement or any other material agreement between the Participant and the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) the Participants conviction of, or plea of nolo contendere to, any felony or crime of moral turpitude;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) repeated and knowing material failure by the Participant to comply with the Companys written policies or rules, after written notice of such failure; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) gross negligence or willful misconduct that does or reasonably could be expected to cause material harm to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.8 A Change in Control shall be deemed to have occurred (unless otherwise determined by the Administrator) on the date upon which:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) there occurs a merger or consolidation the Company or any direct or indirect Subsidiary of the Company with any other corporation, other than (1) a merger or consolidation which would result in the holders of voting securities of the Company outstanding immediately prior to such merger or consolidation continuing to own, (either by remaining outstanding or by being converted into voting securities of the surviving entity or any parent thereof) at least fifty percent (50%) of the combined voting power of the securities of the Company or such surviving entity or any Parent thereof outstanding immediately after such merger or consolidation, or (2) a merger or consolidation effected to implement a recapitalization of the Company (or similar transaction) in which no person (as such term is defined in Section 13(d)(3) and 14(d)(2) of the Exchange Act), corporation or other entity (other than the Company, an Affiliate or any benefit plan (or related trust) sponsored by the Company or any Affiliate) is or becomes the beneficial owner (as such term is defined in Rule 13d-3 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company representing thirty-five percent (35%) or more of the combined voting power of the Companys then-outstanding securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) there occurs any sale, lease, exchange, or other transfer (in one transaction or a series of related transactions) of all, or substantially all, of the assets of the Company to any person (as such term is defined in Section 13(d)(3) and 14(d)(2) of the Exchange Act) that is not an Affiliate, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) there is an adoption of any plan or proposal for the liquidation or dissolution of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) any person (as such term is defined in Section 13
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)(2) of the Exchange Act), corporation, or other entity (other than the Company, an Affiliate or any benefit plan (or related trust) sponsored by the Company or any Affiliate) purchases Common Stock of the Company (or securities convertible into the Common Stock) representing thirty-five percent (35%) or more of the combined voting power of the Companys then-outstanding securities for cash, securities or any other consideration pursuant to a tender offer or exchange offer, without the prior consent of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) any person (as such term is defined in Section 13
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)(2) of the Exchange Act),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) any person (as such term is defined in Section 13
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)(2) of the Exchange Act), corporation or other entity (other than the Company, an Affiliate or any benefit plan (or related trust) sponsored by the Company or any Affiliate) becomes the beneficial owner (as such term is defined in Rule 13d-3 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company representing thirty-five percent (35%) or more of the combined voting power of the then- outstanding securities of the Company ordinarily (and apart from rights accruing under special circumstances) having the right to vote in the election of directors (calculated as provided in paragraph
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) of such Rule 13d-3 in the case of rights to acquire the Companys securities); or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) during any period of two (2) consecutive years, the individuals who at the beginning of such period constituted the entire Board cease, for any reason, to constitute a majority thereof, unless the election, or the nomination for election by the Companys shareholders, of each new Director was approved by a vote of at least two-thirds of the Directors then still in office who were directors at the beginning of the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, if a Change in Control constitutes a payment event with respect to any Award which provides for the eferral of compensation that is subject to Section 409A of the Code, to the extent required to avoid the imposition of additional taxes nder Section 409A of the Code, the transaction or event(s) described in this Section 2.8 with respect to such Award shall only onstitute a Change in Control for purposes of the payment timing of such Award if such transaction also constitutes a change in ontrol event, as defined under Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the terms of this Section 2.8, the Administrator shall have ull and final authority to determine conclusively whether a Change in Control of the Company has occurred pursuant to the above efinition, the date of the occurrence of such Change in Control and any incidental matters relating thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.9 Code shall mean the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time, together with the regulations and official guidance promulgated thereunder, whether issued prior or subsequent to the grant of any Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.10 Committee shall mean the Compensation Committee of the Board, or another committee or subcommittee of the Board described in Article XII hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.11 Common Stock shall mean the common stock of the Company, par value $0.01 per Share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.12 Company shall mean OReilly Automotive, Inc., a Missouri corporation, and any successor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.13 Consultant shall mean any consultant or adviser engaged to provide services to the Company or any Affiliate that qualifies as a consultant under the applicable rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission for registration of Shares on a Form S-8 Registration Statement or any successor Form thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.14 Covered Employee shall mean any Employee who is a covered employee within the meaning of Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.15 Covered Shares means any Shares acquired by an Executive Officer pursuant to an Award granted under the Plan, net of Shares retained by the Company to satisfy tax withholding requirements attributable to such Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.16 Deferred Stock shall mean a right to receive Shares awarded under Section 9.4 hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.17 Director shall mean a member of the Board, as constituted from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.18 Disability shall mean a condition such that an individual would be considered disabled for the oses of Section 409(A) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.19 Dividend Equivalent shall mean a right to receive the equivalent value (in cash or Shares) of dividends paid on Shares, awarded under Section 9.2 hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.20 Effective Date shall mean the date the Plan is approved by the shareholders of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.21 Eligible Individual shall mean any natural person who is an Employee, a Consultant or a Non- Employee Director, as determined by the Administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.22 Employee shall mean any officer or other employee of the Company or any Affiliate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.23 Equity Restructuring shall mean a non-reciprocal transaction between the Company and its shareholders, such as a stock dividend, stock split, spin-off, rights offering or recapitalization through a large, non-recurring cash dividend, that affects the number or kind of Shares (or other securities of the Company) or the Share price of Common Stock (or other securities) and causes a change in the per Share value of the Common Stock underlying outstanding stock-based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.24 Exchange Act shall mean the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.25 Fair Market Value shall mean, as of any given date, the value of a Share determined as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) if the Common Stock is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) listed on any established securities exchange (such as the New York Stock Exchange or the NASDAQ Stock Market),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) listed on any national market system or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) listed, quoted or traded on any automated quotation system, its Fair Market Value shall be the closing sales price for a Share as quoted on such exchange or system for such date or, if there is no closing sales price for a Share on the date in question, the closing sales price for a Share on the last preceding date for which such quotation exists, as reported in The Wall Street Journal or such other source as the Administrator deems reliable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) if the Common Stock is traded only otherwise than on any established securities exchange and is not quoted on the NASDAQ Stock Market, the closing quoted selling price of the Common Stock on such date as quoted in pink sheets published by the OTC Markets Group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: c) if the Common Stock is not listed on an established securities exchange, national market
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: system or automated quotation system, but the Common Stock is regularly quoted by a recognized securities dealer, its Fair Market Value shall be the mean of the high bid and low asked prices for a Share on such date or, if there are no high bid and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: low asked prices for a Share on such date, the high bid and low asked prices for a Share on the last preceding date for which such information exists, as reported in The Wall Street Journal or such other source as the Administrator deems reliable; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) if the Common Stock is neither listed on an established securities exchange, national market system or automated quotation system nor regularly quoted by a recognized securities dealer, its Fair Market Value shall be established by the Administrator in good faith on the date awarded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.26 Greater Than 10% Shareholder shall mean an individual then-owning (within the meaning of Section 424
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) of the Code) more than ten percent (10%) of the total combined voting power of all classes of stock of the Company or any parent corporation or subsidiary corporation (as defined in Sections 424
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) and 424
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) of the Code, respectively).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.27 Incentive Stock Option shall mean an Option that is intended to qualify as an incentive stock option and conforms to the applicable provisions of Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.28 Individual Award Limit shall mean the cash and Share limits applicable to Awards granted under the Plan, as set forth in Section 3.3 hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.29 Executive Officer means an executive officer, as defined in Rule 3b-7 of the rules and regulations of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.30 Non-Employee Director shall mean a Director of the Company who is not an Employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.31 Non-Qualified Stock Option shall mean an Option that is not an Incentive Stock Option or which is designated as an Incentive Stock Option but does not meet the applicable requirements of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.32 Officer shall mean a person who is an officer of the Company within the meaning of Section 16 of the Exchange Act and the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.33 Option shall mean a right to purchase Shares at a specified exercise price, granted under Article VI hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An Option shall be either a Non-Qualified Stock Option or an Incentive Stock Option; provided, that Options granted to Non- Employee Directors and Consultants shall only be Non-Qualified Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.34 Other Incentive Award shall mean an Award denominated in, linked to or derived from Shares or value metrics related to Shares, granted pursuant to Section 9.7 hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.35 Parent shall mean any entity (other than the Company), whether domestic or foreign, in an unbroken chain of entities ending with the Company if each of the entities other than the Company beneficially owns, at the time of the determination, securities or interests representing more than fifty percent (50%) of the total combined voting power of all classes of securities or interests in one of the other entities in such chain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.36 Participant shall mean an Eligible Individual who has been granted an Award or, if applicable, such other Person who holds an outstanding Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.37 Performance Award shall mean an Award that is granted under Section 9.1 hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.38 Performance-Based Compensation shall mean any compensation that is intended to qualify as performance-based compensation as described in Section 162(m)(4)(C) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.39 Performance Criteria shall mean the criterion or criteria (and adjustments) that the Committee selects for an Award for purposes of establishing the Performance Goal or Performance Goals for a Performance Period, determined as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) The Performance Criteria that shall be used to establish Performance Goals are limited to the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) net earnings (either before or after one or more of the following: (A) interest, (B) taxes, (C) depreciation, (D) amortization and (E) non-cash equity-based compensation expense);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) gross or net sales or revenue;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) net income (either before or after taxes);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) adjusted net income;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) operating income, earnings or profit;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) cash flow (including, but not limited to,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: operating cash flow and free cash flow);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) return on assets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii) return on capital;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ix) return on invested capital;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) return on shareholders equity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xi) total shareholder return;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xii) return on sales;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xiii) gross or net
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: profit or operating margin; (xiv) costs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xv) funds from operations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xvi) expenses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xvii) working capital;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xviii) earnings per Share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xix) adjusted earnings per Share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xx) price per Share; (xxi) regulatory body approval for commercialization of a product; (xxii) implementation or completion of critical projects; (xxiii) market share; (xxiv) economic value; (xxv) debt levels or reduction; (xxvi) customer retention; (xxvii) sales-related goals; (xxviii) comparisons with other stock market indices; (xxvix) operating efficiency; (xxx) customer satisfaction and/or growth; (xxxi) employee satisfaction; (xxxii) research and development achievements; (xxxiii) financing and other capital raising transactions; (xxxiv) recruiting and maintaining personnel; (xxxv) year- end cash, (xxxvi) inventory, (xxxvii) inventory turns, (xxxviii) net inventory turns, (xxxvix) new store openings, (xl) new store performance, (xli) average transaction size, (xlii) customer traffic, (xliii) accounts payable to inventory ratio, (xliv) employee retention, (xlv) comparable store sales and (xlvi) capital expenditures, any of which may be measured either in absolute terms for the Company or any operating unit of the Company or as compared to any incremental increase or decrease or as compared to results of a peer group or to market performance indicators or indices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) The Administrator may, in its sole discretion, provide that one or more objectively determinable adjustments shall be made to one or more of the Performance Goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such adjustments may include, but are not limited to, one or more of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) items related to a change in accounting principle;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) items relating to financing activities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) expenses for restructuring or productivity initiatives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) other non-operating items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) items related to acquisitions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) items attributable to the business operations of any entity acquired by the Company during the Performance Period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) items related to the disposal or sale of a business or segment of a business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii) items related to discontinued operations that do not qualify as a segment of a business under Applicable Accounting Standards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ix) items attributable to any stock dividend, stock split, combination or exchange of stock occurring during the Performance Period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) any other items of significant income or expense which are determined to be appropriate adjustments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xi) items relating to unusual or extraordinary corporate transactions, events or developments,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xii) items related to amortization of acquired intangible assets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xiii) items that are outside the scope of the Companys core, on-going business activities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xiv) items related to acquired in-process research and development;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xv) items relating to changes in tax laws;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xvi) items relating to major licensing or partnership arrangements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xvii) items relating to asset impairment charges;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xviii) items relating to gains or losses for litigation, arbitration and contractual settlements; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (xix) items relating to any other unusual or non-recurring events or changes in applicable laws, accounting principles or business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all Awards intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation, such determinations shall be made within the time prescribed by, and otherwise in compliance with, Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted under Section 162(m) of the Code (including, without limitation, compliance with and any requirements for shareholder approval), the Committee may designate additional Performance Criteria on which Performance Goals may be based, and may adjust, modify, or amend Performance Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.40 Performance Goals shall mean, with respect to a Performance Period, one or more goals established in writing by the Committee for the Performance Period based upon one or more Performance Criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Depending on the Performance Criteria used to establish such Performance Goals, the Performance Goals may be expressed in terms of overall Company performance or the performance of an Affiliate, a division or business unit, or one or more individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, such performance goals may be based upon the attainment of specified levels of performance under one or more of the measures described above relative to the performance of other corporations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The achievement of each Performance Goal shall be determined in accordance with Applicable Accounting Standards, to the extent applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.41 Performance Period shall mean one or more periods of time, which may be of varying and overlapping durations, as the Administrator may select, over which the attainment of one or more Performance Goals will be measured for the purpose of determining a Participants right to, and the payment of, a Performance Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.55 Subsidiary shall mean any entity (other than the Company), whether domestic or foreign, in an unbroken chain of entities beginning with the Company if each of the entities other than the last entity in the unbroken chain beneficially owns, at the time of the determination, securities or interests representing more than fifty percent (50%) of the total combined voting power of all classes of securities or interests in one of the other entities in such chain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.56 Substitute Award shall mean an Award granted under the Plan in connection with a corporate transaction, such as a merger, combination, consolidation or acquisition of property or stock, in any case, upon the assumption of, or in substitution for, an outstanding equity award previously granted by a company or other entity; provided, that in no event shall the term Substitute Award be construed to refer to an award made in connection with the cancellation and repricing of an Option or Stock Appreciation Right.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.57 Termination of Service shall mean:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) As to a Consultant, the time when the engagement of a Participant as a Consultant to the Company and its Affiliates is terminated for any reason, with or without Cause, including, without limitation, by resignation, discharge, death or Retirement, but excluding terminations where the Consultant simultaneously commences or remains in employment and/or service as an Employee and/or Director with the Company or any Affiliate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) As to a Non-Employee Director, the time when a Participant who is a Non-Employee Director ceases to be a Director for any reason, including, without limitation, a termination by resignation, failure to be elected, death or Retirement, but excluding terminations where the Participant simultaneously commences or remains in employment or service as an Employee and/or Consultant with the Company or any Affiliate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) As to an Employee, the time when the employee-employer relationship between a Participant and the Company and its Affiliates is terminated for any reason, including, without limitation, a termination by resignation, discharge, death, Disability or Retirement, but excluding terminations where the Participant simultaneously commences or remains in service with the Company or any Affiliate as a Consultant and/or Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator, in its sole discretion, shall determine the effect of all matters and questions relating to Terminations of Service, ncluding without limitation, whether a Termination of Service has occurred, whether any Termination of Service resulted from a discharge for Cause and whether any particular leave of absence constitutes a Termination of Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Plan, a Participants employee-employer relationship or consultancy relationship with an Affiliate shall be deemed to be terminated in the event that the Affiliate employing or contracting with such Participant ceases to remain an Affiliate following any merger, sale of stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: or other corporate transaction or event (including, without limitation, a spin-off)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE III SHARES SUBJECT TO THE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.1 Number of Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) As of the Effective Date, no additional awards will be granted under the Prior Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards granted under the Prior Plan remain subject to the terms of the Prior Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards granted on or after the Effective Date will be subject to the terms of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Subject to Sections 3.1(d) and 13.2 hereof, the maximum aggregate number of Shares available for issuance under the Plan (the Share Limit) shall be the sum of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the number of Shares that remain available for issuance under the Prior Plan as of the Effectives Date and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the number of Shares subject to outstanding awards under the Prior Plan that are outstanding as of the Effective Date, and which expire, or for any reason are cancelled or terminated after such date without being exercised or before any applicable restrictions lapse, or are added back to the Prior Plan or the Plan pursuant to the terms of such plans, with such maximum number of Shares not to exceed 10,000,000 Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the generality of the foregoing, subject to Sections 3.1(d) and 13.2 hereof, the maximum number of Shares available for issuance under the Plan with respect to Incentive Stock Options shall be 2,000,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) For purposes of this Section 3.1, if an Award entitled the holder thereof to receive or purchase Shares, the number of Shares covered
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) by Awards of Options or Stock Appreciate Rights shall be counted on the date of grant of such Awards against the Share Limit as one Share for each Share underlying such Awards granted and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) by Awards other than Options or Stock Appreciation Rights shall be counted on the date of grant of such Awards against the Share Limit as three Shares for each Share or Share underlying such Awards granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if any Shares covered by an Award or to which an Award relates are not purchased or are forfeited, or if an Award otherwise terminates without delivery of any Shares, then the number of Shares counted against the aggregate number of Shares available under the Plan with respect to such Award, to the extent of any such forfeiture or termination, shall again be available for granting awards under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares that again become available for grant pursuant to the preceding sentence shall be added back to the Share Limit as one Share if subject to Awards of Options or Stock Appreciation Rights and as three Shares if subject to Awards other than Options or Stock Appreciation Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, Shares subject to an Award under the Plan shall not again be made available for issuance under the Plan if such Shares are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (w) Shares tendered in payment of an Option,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) Shares delivered or withheld by the Company to satisfy any tax withholding obligation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (y) Shares repurchased by the Company with Option proceeds or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (z) Shares subject to a stock-settled Stock Appreciation Right or another Award that were not issued upon the settlement of the Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Substitute Awards shall not reduce the Shares authorized for grant under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, in the event that a company acquired by the Company or any Affiliate, or with which the Company or any Affiliate combines, has shares available under a pre-existing plan approved by its shareholders and not adopted in contemplation of such acquisition or combination, the shares available for grant pursuant to the terms of such pre-existing plan (as adjusted, to the extent appropriate, using the exchange ratio or other adjustment or valuation ratio or formula used in such acquisition or combination to determine the consideration payable to the holders of common stock of the entities party to such acquisition or combination) may be used for Awards under the Plan in the Boards discretion at the time of such acquisition or combination, as applicable, and shall not reduce the Shares authorized for grant under the Plan; provided, that Awards using such available shares shall not be made after the date awards or grants could have been made under the terms of the pre-existing plan, absent the acquisition or combination, and shall only be made to individuals who were not employed by or providing services to the Company or its Affiliates immediately prior to such acquisition or combination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.2 Stock Distributed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Shares distributed pursuant to an Award may consist, in whole or in part, of authorized and unissued Common Stock, treasury Common Stock or Common Stock purchased on the open market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.3 Individual Award Limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Notwithstanding any provision in the Plan to the contrary, and subject to Section 13.2 hereof, to ply with Section 162(m) of the Code:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the aggregate number of Shares subject to Options and Stock Appreciation Rights awarded to any one Participant during any calendar year may not exceed 1,000,000 Shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the aggregate number of Shares subject to Awards other than Options and Stock Appreciation Rights (excluding Awards referenced in Section 3.3(a)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) below) awarded to any one Participant during any calendar year may not exceed 1,000,000 Shares; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the aggregate amount of compensation to be paid to any one Participant in respect to all Awards that are intended to constitute Performance-Based Compensation denominated in cash in any calendar year is $10,000,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Notwithstanding any provision in the Plan to the contrary, in any calendar year, no Non- Employee Director may receive Awards granted under the Plan that, when taken together with cash fees and awards granted under any other Company equity plan to such Non-Employee Director, exceed $1,000,000 in total value (calculating the value of any such awards based on the grant date Fair Market Value of such awards and excluding, for this purpose, the value of any dividends or dividend equivalents paid pursuant to any award granted in a previous calendar year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Awards granted to an individual while he or she was an Employee but not a Non-Employee Director, will not count for purposes of the limitations under this Section 3.3(b).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE IV
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GRANTING OF AWARDS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.1 Participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may, from time to time, select from among all Eligible Individuals, those to whom one or more Awards shall be granted and shall determine the nature and amount of each Award, which shall not be inconsistent with the requirements of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as provided in any applicable Program, no Eligible Individual shall have any right to be granted an Award pursuant to the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards that are intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation shall be subject to the provisions of Article V of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.2 Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Award shall be evidenced by an Award Agreement stating the terms and conditions applicable to such Award, consistent with the requirements of the Plan and any applicable Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Award Agreement evidencing Awards intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation shall contain such terms and conditions as may be necessary to meet the applicable provisions of Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award Agreements evidencing Incentive Stock Options shall contain such terms and conditions as may be necessary to meet the applicable provisions of Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.3 Limitations Applicable to Section 16 Persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding anything contained herein to the contrary, with respect to any Award granted or awarded to any individual who is then-subject to Section 16 of the Exchange Act, the Plan, any applicable Program and the applicable Award Agreement shall be subject to any additional limitations set forth in any applicable exemptive rule under Section 16 of the Exchange Act (including Rule 16b-3 of the Exchange Act and any amendments thereto) that are requirements for the application of such exemptive rule, and such additional limitations shall be deemed to be incorporated by reference into such Award to the extent permitted by applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.4 At-Will Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nothing in the Plan or in any Program or Award Agreement hereunder shall confer upon any Participant any right to continue as an Employee, Director or Consultant of the Company or any Affiliate, or shall interfere with or restrict in any way the rights of the Company or any Affiliate, which rights are hereby expressly reserved, to discharge any Participant at any time for any reason whatsoever, with or without Cause, and with or without notice, or to terminate or change all other terms and conditions of any Participants employment or engagement, except to the extent expressly provided otherwise in a written agreement between the Participant and the Company or any Affiliate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.5 Foreign Participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the contrary, in order to comply with the laws in other countries in which the Company and its Affiliates operate or have Employees, Non-Employee Directors or Consultants, or in order to comply with the requirements of any foreign securities exchange, the Administrator, in its sole discretion, shall have the power and authority to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) determine which Affiliates shall be covered by the Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) determine which Eligible Individuals outside the United States are eligible to participate in the Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) modify the terms and conditions of any Award granted to Eligible Individuals outside the United States to comply with applicable foreign laws or listing requirements of any such foreign securities exchange;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) establish subplans and modify exercise procedures and other terms and procedures, to the extent such actions may be necessary or advisable (and any such subplans and/or modifications shall be attached to the Plan as appendices); provided, that no such subplans and/or modifications shall increase the Share Limit or Individual Award Limits contained in Sections 3.1 and 3.3 hereof, respectively; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) take any action, before or after an Award is made, that it deems advisable to obtain approval or comply
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: with any necessary local governmental regulatory exemptions or approvals or listing requirements of any such foreign securities exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administrator may not take any actions hereunder, and no Awards shall be granted, that would violate the Code, the Exchange Act, the Securities Act, the rules of the securities exchange or automated quotation system on which the Shares are listed, quoted or traded or any other applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.6 Stand-Alone and Tandem Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted pursuant to the Plan may, in the sole discretion of the Administrator, be granted either alone, in addition to or in tandem with, any other Award granted pursuant to the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted in addition to or in tandem with other Awards may be granted either at the same time as or at a different time from the grant of such other Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE V
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROVISIONS APPLICABLE TO AWARDS INTENDED TO QUALIFY AS PERFORMANCE-BASED COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.1 Purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, in its sole discretion, may determine whether any Award is intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Committee, in its sole discretion, decides to grant an Award to an Eligible Individual that is intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation, then the provisions of this Article V shall control over any contrary provision contained in the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may in its sole discretion grant Awards to Eligible Individuals that are based on Performance Criteria or Performance Goals but that do not satisfy the requirements of this Article V and that are not intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise specified by the Committee at the time of grant, the Performance Criteria with respect to an Award intended to be Performance-Based Compensation payable to a Covered Employee shall be determined on the basis of Applicable Accounting Standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.2 Applicability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of an Award to an Eligible Individual for a particular Performance Period shall not require the grant of an Award to such Eligible Individual in any subsequent Performance Period and the grant of an Award to any one Eligible Individual shall not require the grant of an Award to any other Eligible Individual in such period or in any other period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.3 Procedures with Respect to Performance-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent necessary to comply with the requirements of Section 162(m)(4)(C) of the Code, with respect to any Award which is intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation, no later than ninety (90) days following the commencement of any Performance Period or any designated fiscal period or period of service (or, if longer or shorter, within the maximum period allowed under Section 162(m) of the Code), the Committee shall, in writing,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) designate one or more Eligible Individuals,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) select the Performance Criteria applicable to the Performance Period,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) establish the Performance Goals and amounts of such Awards, as applicable, which may be earned for such Performance Period based on the Performance Goals, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) specify the relationship between the Performance Criteria and the Performance Goals and the amounts of such Awards, as applicable, to be earned by each Covered Employee for such Performance Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the completion of each Performance Period, the Committee shall certify in writing whether and the extent to which the applicable Performance Goals have been achieved for such Performance Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the amount earned under such Awards, unless otherwise provided in an applicable Program or Award Agreement, the Committee shall have the right to reduce or eliminate (but not to increase) the amount payable at a given level of performance to take into account additional factors that the Committee may deem relevant, including the assessment of individual or corporate performance for the Performance Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.4 Payment of Performance-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise provided in the applicable Program or Award Agreement (and only to the extent otherwise permitted by Section 162(m)(4)(C) of the Code), the holder of an Award that is intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation must be employed by the Company or an Affiliate throughout the applicable Performance Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Awards shall be paid, unless otherwise determined by the Committee, no later than two and one-half (2) months after the tax year in which the Performance Award vests, consistent with the requirements of Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise provided in the applicable Performance Goals, Program or Award Agreement, a Participant shall be eligible to receive payment pursuant to such Awards for a Performance Period only if and to the extent the Performance Goals for such applicable Performance Period are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.5 Additional Limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan and except as otherwise determined by the Administrator, any Award which is granted to an Eligible Individual and is intended to qualify as Performance- Based Compensation shall be subject to any additional limitations imposed under Section 162(m) of the Code that are requirements for qualification as Performance-Based Compensation, and the Plan, the Program and the Award Agreement shall be deemed amended to the extent necessary to conform to such requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE VI
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GRANTING OF OPTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.1 Granting of Options to Eligible Individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator is authorized to grant Options to Eligible Individuals from time to time, in its sole discretion, on such terms and conditions as it may determine which shall not be inconsistent with the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.2 Qualification of Incentive Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Incentive Stock Option shall be granted to any person who is not an Employee of the Company or any parent corporation or subsidiary corporation of the Company (as defined in Sections 424
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) and 424
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) of the Code, respectively).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No person who qualifies as a Greater Than 10% Shareholder may be granted an Incentive Stock Option unless such Incentive Stock Option conforms to the applicable provisions of Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Incentive Stock Option granted under the Plan may be modified by the Administrator, with the consent of the Participant, to disqualify such Option from treatment as an incentive stock option under Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that the aggregate fair market value of stock with respect to which incentive stock options (within the meaning of Section 422 of the Code, but without regard to Section 422(d) of the Code) are exercisable for the first time by a Participant during any calendar year under the Plan and all other plans of the Company and any Affiliate corporation thereof exceeds $100,000, the Options shall be treated as Non-Qualified Stock Options to the extent required by Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rule set forth in the preceding sentence shall be applied by taking Options and other incentive stock options into account in the order in which they were granted and the Fair Market Value of stock shall be determined as of the time the respective options were granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, to the extent that any Options otherwise fail to qualify as Incentive Stock Options, such Options shall be treated as Non-Qualified Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.3 Option Exercise Price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as provided in Section 6.6 hereof, the exercise price per Share subject to each Option shall be set by the Administrator, but shall not be less than one hundred percent (100%) of the Fair Market Value of a Share on the date the Option is granted (or, as to Incentive Stock Options, on the date the Option is modified, extended or renewed for purposes of Section 424(h) of the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in the case of Incentive Stock Options granted to a Greater Than 10% Shareholder, such price shall not be less than one hundred ten percent (110%) of the Fair Market Value of a Share on the date the Option is granted (or the date the Option is modified, extended or renewed for purposes of Section 424(h) of the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.4 Option Term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of each Option shall be set by the Administrator in its sole discretion; provided, that the term shall not be more than ten (10) years from the date the Option is granted, or five (5) years from the date an Incentive Stock Option is granted to a Greater Than 10% Shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator shall determine the time period, including the time period following a Termination of Service, during which the Participant has the right to exercise the vested Options, which time period may not extend beyond the stated term of the Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as limited by the requirements of Section 409A or Section 422 of the Code, the Administrator may extend the term of any outstanding Option, and may extend the time period during which vested Options may be exercised, in connection with any Termination of Service of the Participant, and, subject to Section 13.1 hereof, may amend any other term or condition of such Option relating to such a Termination of Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.5 Option Vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) No portion of an Option which is unexercisable at a Participants Termination of Service (including due to Retirement) shall thereafter become exercisable, except as may be otherwise provided by the Administrator either in an applicable Program, the applicable Award Agreement or by action of the Administrator following the grant of the Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.6 Substitute Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this Article VI to the contrary, in the ase of an Option that is a Substitute Award, the price per Share of the Shares subject to such Option may be less than the Fair Market Value per Share on the date of grant; provided, that the exercise price of any Substitute Award shall be determined in accordance with he applicable requirements of Sections 424 and 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.7 Substitution of Stock Appreciation Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may, in its sole discretion, substitute an Award of Stock Appreciation Rights for an outstanding Option at any time prior to or upon exercise of such Option; provided, that such Stock Appreciation Rights shall be exercisable with respect to the same number of Shares for which such substituted Option would have been exercisable, and shall also have the same exercise price and remaining term as the substituted Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE VII
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXERCISE OF OPTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.1 Partial Exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An exercisable Option may be exercised in whole or in part.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, an Option shall not be exercisable with respect to fractional Shares and the Administrator may require that, by the terms of the Option, a partial exercise must be with respect to a minimum number of Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.2 Manner of Exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All or a portion of an exercisable Option shall be deemed exercised upon delivery of all of the following to the stock administrator of the Company, or such other person or entity designated by the Administrator:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) A written or electronic notice complying with the applicable rules established by the Administrator stating that the Option, or a portion thereof, is exercised.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice shall be signed by the Participant or other person then entitled to exercise the Option or such portion of the Option;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Such representations and documents as the Administrator, in its sole discretion, deems necessary or advisable to effect compliance with all applicable provisions of the Securities Act, the Exchange Act, any other federal, state or foreign securities laws or regulations, the rules of any securities exchange or automated quotation system on which the Shares are listed, quoted or traded or any other applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may, in its sole discretion, also take such additional actions as it deems appropriate to effect such compliance including, without limitation, placing legends on Share certificates and issuing stop-transfer notices to agents and registrars;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) In the event that the Option shall be exercised pursuant to Section 11.3 hereof by any person or persons other than the Participant, appropriate proof of the right of such person or persons to exercise the Option, as determined in the sole discretion of the Administrator; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Full payment of the exercise price and applicable withholding taxes to the stock administrator of the Company for the Shares with respect to which the Option, or portion thereof, is exercised, in a manner permitted by the Administrator in accordance with Sections 11.1 and 11.2 hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.3 Notification Regarding Disposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Participant shall give the Company prompt written or lectronic notice of any disposition of Shares acquired by exercise of an Incentive Stock Option which occurs within
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) two (2) years rom the date of granting (including the date the Option is modified, extended or renewed for purposes of Section 424(h) of the Code) uch Option to such Participant, or (b) one (1) year after the transfer of such Shares to such Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE VIII
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESTRICTED STOCK
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.1 Award of Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) The Administrator is authorized to grant Restricted Stock to Eligible Individuals, and shall determine the terms and conditions, including the restrictions, applicable to each Award of Restricted Stock, which terms and conditions shall not be inconsistent with the Plan, and may impose such conditions on the issuance of such Restricted Stock as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) The Administrator shall establish the purchase price, if any, and form of payment for Restricted Stock; provided, that if a purchase price is charged, such purchase price shall be no less than the par value of the Shares to be purchased, unless otherwise permitted by applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In all cases, legal consideration shall be required for each issuance of Restricted Stock to the extent required by applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.2 Rights as Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to Sections 8.4 and 11.11 hereof and the restrictions in an applicable Program or in the applicable Award Agreement, upon issuance of Restricted Stock, the Participant shall have, unless otherwise provided by the Administrator, all the rights of a shareholder with respect to said Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes, but is not limited to, the right to vote Shares of Restricted Stock as the record owner thereof, and, unless otherwise determined by the Administrator, the right to receive dividends and other distributions payable to an Eligible Individual during the vesting or restriction period if and when the restrictions imposed on the applicable Restricted Stock lapse; provided, that, in the sole discretion of the Administrator, any extraordinary distributions with respect to the Shares shall be subject to the restrictions set forth in Section 8.3 hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.3 Restrictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Shares of Restricted Stock (including any Shares received by Participants thereof with respect to Shares of Restricted Stock as a result of stock dividends, stock splits or any other form of recapitalization) shall, in the terms of an applicable Program or the applicable Award Agreement, be subject to such restrictions and vesting requirements as the Administrator shall provide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such restrictions may include, without limitation, restrictions concerning voting rights and transferability and such restrictions may lapse separately or in combination at such times and pursuant to such circumstances or based on such criteria as selected by the Administrator, including, without limitation, criteria based on the Participants duration of employment, directorship or consultancy with the Company, the Performance Criteria, Company or Affiliate performance, individual performance or other criteria selected by the Administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock may not be sold or encumbered until all restrictions are terminated or expire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.4 Repurchase or Forfeiture of Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If no price was paid by the Participant for the Restricted Stock, upon a Termination of Service, the Participants rights in unvested Restricted Stock then-subject to restrictions shall lapse, and such Restricted Stock shall be surrendered to the Company and cancelled without consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a price was paid by the Participant for the Restricted Stock, upon a Termination of Service, the Company shall have the right to repurchase from the Participant the unvested Restricted Stock then-subject to restrictions at a cash price per Share equal to the price paid by the Participant for such Restricted Stock or such other amount as may be specified in an applicable Program or the applicable Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator in its sole discretion may provide that, upon certain events, including, without limitation, a Change in Control, the Participants death, Retirement or Disability, any other specified Termination of Service or any other event, the Participants rights in unvested Restricted Stock shall not lapse, such Restricted Stock shall vest and cease to be forfeitable and, if applicable, the Company shall cease to have a right of repurchase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.5 Certificates for Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock granted pursuant to the Plan may be evidenced in such manner as the Administrator shall determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certificates or book entries evidencing shares of Restricted Stock must include an appropriate legend referring to the terms, conditions, and restrictions applicable to such Restricted Stock, and the Company may, in its sole discretion, retain physical possession of any stock certificate until such time as all applicable restrictions lapse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8.6 Section 83
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a Participant makes an election under Section 83
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) of the Code to be taxed with respect to the Restricted Stock as of the date of transfer of the Restricted Stock rather than as of the date or dates upon which the Participant would otherwise be taxable under Section 83
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) of the Code, the Participant shall be required to deliver a copy of such election to the Company promptly after filing such election with the Internal Revenue Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE IX
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PERFORMANCE AWARDS, DIVIDEND EQUIVALENTS, STOCK PAYMENTS, DEFERRED STOCK, RESTRICTED STOCK UNITS, PERFORMANCE SHARE AWARDS, OTHER INCENTIVE AWARDS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.1 Performance Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) The Administrator is authorized to grant Performance Awards to any Eligible Individual and to determine whether such Performance Awards shall be Performance-Based Compensation per Article V of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of Performance Awards may be linked to any one or more of the Performance Criteria or other specific criteria determined by the Administrator, in each case on a specified date or dates or over any period or periods determined by the Administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Awards may be paid in cash, Shares or a combination of both, as determined by the Administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Without limiting Section 9.1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) hereof, the Administrator may grant Performance Awards to any Eligible Individual in the form of a cash bonus payable upon the attainment of objective Performance Goals, or such other criteria, whether or not objective, which are established by the Administrator, in each case on a specified date or dates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: or over any period or periods determined by the Administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such bonuses paid to a Participant which are intended to be Performance-Based Compensation shall be based upon objectively determinable bonus formulas established in accordance with the provisions of Article V hereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.2 Dividend Equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Subject to Sections 9.2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) and 11.11 hereof, Dividend Equivalents may be granted by the Administrator to an Eligible Individual based on dividends declared on Shares that are subject to another Award granted to the Eligible Individual, with such Dividend Equivalents to be credited as of dividend payment dates during the period between the date the Dividend Equivalents are granted and the date such Dividend Equivalents terminate or expire, as determined by the Administrator; provided, that Dividend Equivalents shall only be paid out to an Eligible Individual at the same time or times and to the same extent that the vesting conditions of the underlying Award are satisfied and such Award vests with respect to the Shares subject to such Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such Dividend Equivalents shall be converted to cash or additional Shares by such formula, at such time and subject to such limitations as may be determined by the Administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Notwithstanding the foregoing, no Dividend Equivalents shall be payable with respect to Options or Stock Appreciation Rights, unless otherwise determined by the Administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9.3 Stock Payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator is authorized to make one or more Stock Payments to any Eligible Individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number or value of Shares of any Stock Payment shall be determined by the Administrator and may be based upon one or more Performance Criteria or any other specific criteria, including service to the Company or any Affiliate, determined by the Administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Payments may, but are not required to, be made in lieu of base salary, bonus, fees or other cash compensation otherwise payable to such Eligible Individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
